intro: Viola filicaulis, commonly known as the slender violet, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, featuring heart-shaped leaves with a hairy texture. The plant produces violet-blue flowers with five petals, often marked with distinctive patterns. It thrives in moist, shady environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies.
